thread.title: Seeing camera flashes, but no camera around?

post.author: ajm113
post.body:
I'm really starting to get very curious on what is going on here since I am noticing it more. But for some odd reason, even during the day or night which is kinda rare sometimes. I see a flash of light and a flare if I have a view of it. The wired thing too is that it's projecting shadows sometimes and actually casting light, it kinda looks like a camera flash.

Tonight as I just was walking back up stairs I noticed the flare flash outside of the front door, and the glass isn't very clear from a distance and the 'flash' was kinda blurred out and small through the window. I looked of course no one and it's 11 PM.

One other night I believe I was going to my window and closing the curtains and I notice a flash in the dark in the backyard of my neighbors and I swore I seen the ray of light hitting on the sides of my window.

I get the feeling now since I am noticing it that someone is fallowing me, but wired thing too is that I notice it in the most random places sometimes, I don't really know what is wrong...

I know D3W isn't a 'medical' forum, but perhaps with intelligent users I can get some info what to do or someone else experiences with this?

post.author: Kiltron
post.body:
Perhaps you're at that crossover point from reality vs. virtual reality.

What I'm saying is, compare how much time you spend in reality as apposed to how much you spend in VR. (playing FPS games or games in general but more so FPS games)

If you spend more time in VR than in reality, your brain starts thinking you're in VR at times when you are in reality and some of the effects (realtime lighting, shadow casting, etc.) found in today's FPS games feel like they're happening in regular reality (though they really are, the brain is thinking it is happening from and in VR)

And no, I'm not kidding.
